intro: Lessingia germanorum, commonly known as the German lessingia, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern California and Baja California. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, coastal environments. It has linear, grass-like leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Lessingia germanorum is often found in dunes and is adapted to withstand salt spray and strong winds.
